fields.name: currentUser
fields.description: Returns the authenticated user

fields.description: Returns an event given its id or slug

fields.name: league
fields.description: Returns a league given its id or slug

fields.name: participant
fields.description: Returns a participant given its id

fields.name: phase
fields.description: Returns a phase given its id

fields.name: phaseGroup
fields.description: Returns a phase group given its id

fields.name: player
fields.description: Returns a player given an id

fields.name: seed

fields.name: shop

fields.name: stream
fields.description: Returns an stream given its id

fields.name: streamQueue
fields.description: Returns all the stream queues for a given tournament

fields.name: team
fields.description: Returns a team given its id

fields.name: tournament
fields.description: Returns a tournament given its id or slug

fields.name: tournaments
fields.description: Paginated, filterable list of tournaments

fields.name: user
fields.description: Returns a user given a user slug of the form user/abc123, or id

fields.name: videogame

fields.name: videogames
fields.description: Returns paginated list of videogames matching the search criteria.

types.name: User
types.description: A user

fields.name: authorizations
fields.description: Authorizations to external services (i.e. Twitch, Twitter)

fields.name: birthday
fields.description: Public facing user birthday that respects user publishing settings

fields.name: discriminator
fields.description: Uniquely identifying token for user. Same as the hashed part of the slug

fields.name: events
fields.description: Events this user has competed in

fields.name: leagues
fields.description: Leagues this user has competed in

fields.name: location
fields.description: Public location info for this user

fields.name: name
fields.description: Public facing user name that respects user publishing settings

fields.name: player
fields.description: player for user

fields.name: tournaments
fields.description: Tournaments this user is organizing or competing in

types.name: ID
types.description:
The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to
refetch an object or as key for a cache. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer
(such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: SocialConnectionType
types.description: Represents the name of the third-party social service (e.g Twitter) for OAuth

types.name: ProfileAuthorization
types.description: An OAuth ProfileAuthorization object

fields.name: externalId
fields.description: The id given by the external service

fields.name: externalUsername
fields.description: The username given by the external service (including discriminator if discord)

fields.name: type
fields.description: The name of the external service providing this auth i.e. "twitch"

types.name: String
types.description:
The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8
character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to
represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: Stream
types.description: A Stream object

fields.name: isOnline
fields.description: Whether the stream is currently live. May be slightly delayed.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the stream

fields.name: type
fields.description: The name of the external service providing this auth i.e. "twitch"

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: StreamType
types.description: Represents the type of stream service

types.name: AuthorizationType
types.description: Represents the name of the third-party service (e.g Twitter) for OAuth

inputFields.name: perPage
inputFields.description: How many nodes to return for the page. Maximum value of 500

types.name: Int
types.description:
The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric
values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: JSON
types.description:
The `JSON` scalar type represents JSON values as specified by
		[ECMA-404](http://www.ecma-international.org/publications/files/ECMA-ST/ECMA-404.pdf).

types.name: Event
types.description: An event in a tournament

fields.name: checkInBuffer
fields.description: How long before the event start will the check-in end (in seconds)

fields.name: checkInDuration
fields.description: How long the event check-in will last (in seconds)

fields.name: checkInEnabled
fields.description: Whether check-in is enabled for this event

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: When the event was created (unix timestamp)

fields.name: deckSubmissionDeadline
fields.description: Last date attendees are able to create teams for team events

fields.name: entrantSizeMax
fields.description: Maximum number of participants each Entrant can have
fields.deprecationReason: Migrate to teamRosterSize

fields.name: entrantSizeMin
fields.description: Minimum number of participants each Entrant can have
fields.deprecationReason: Migrate to teamRosterSize

fields.name: entrants
fields.description: The entrants that belong to an event, paginated by filter criteria

fields.name: hasDecks
fields.description: Whether the event has decks

fields.name: hasTasks
fields.description: Are player tasks enabled for this event

fields.name: isOnline
fields.description: Whether the event is an online event or not

fields.name: matchRulesMarkdown
fields.description: Markdown field for match rules/instructions

fields.name: name
fields.description: Title of event set by organizer

fields.name: numEntrants
fields.description: Gets the number of entrants in this event

fields.name: phaseGroups
fields.description: The phase groups that belong to an event.

fields.name: phases
fields.description: The phases that belong to an event.

args.name: state
args.description: Filter phases by state. If not specified will default to all phases

args.name: phaseId
args.description: Optionally only return results for this phase

fields.name: prizingInfo
fields.description: TO settings for prizing

fields.name: rulesMarkdown
fields.description: Markdown field for event rules/instructions

fields.name: rulesetId
fields.description: Id of the event ruleset

fields.name: rulesetSettings
fields.description: Settings pulled from the event ruleset, if one exists
fields.deprecationReason: Use ruleset

fields.name: sets
fields.description: Paginated sets for this Event

args.name: sortType
args.description: How to sort these sets

args.name: filters
args.description: Supported filter options to filter down set results.

fields.name: standings
fields.description: Paginated list of standings

fields.name: startAt
fields.description: When does this event start?

fields.name: state
fields.description: The state of the Event.

fields.name: stations
fields.description: Paginated stations on this event

fields.name: teamManagementDeadline
fields.description: Last date attendees are able to create teams for team events

fields.name: teamNameAllowed
fields.description: If this is a teams event, returns whether or not teams can set custom names

fields.name: teamRosterSize
fields.description: Team roster size requirements

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of the event, whether an entrant will have one participant or multiple

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: When the event was last modified (unix timestamp)

fields.name: useEventSeeds
fields.description: Whether the event uses the new EventSeeds for seeding

fields.name: waves
fields.description: The waves being used by the event

args.name: phaseId
args.description: Waves filtered by phaseId, returns all if not set.

types.name: Timestamp
types.description:
Represents a Unix Timestamp. Supports up to 53 bit int values,
		as that is JavaScript's internal memory allocation for integer values.

types.name: Entrant
types.description: An entrant in an event

fields.name: initialSeedNum
fields.description: Entrant's seed number in the first phase of the event.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The entrant name as it appears in bracket: gamerTag of the participant or team name

fields.name: paginatedSets
fields.description: Paginated sets for this entrant

args.name: sortType
args.description: How to sort these sets

args.name: filters
args.description: Supported filter options to filter down set results.

fields.name: standing
fields.description: Standing for this entrant given an event. All entrants queried must be in the same event (for now).

fields.name: stream
fields.deprecationReason: DEPRECATED. Use streams instead, which supports multiple stream types and teams.

fields.name: team
fields.description: Team linked to this entrant, if one exists

types.name: SetSortType
types.description: Different sort type configurations used when displaying multiple sets

enumValues.name: NONE
enumValues.description: Sets will not be sorted.

enumValues.name: CALL_ORDER
enumValues.description: Sets are sorted in the suggested order that they be called to be played. The order of completed sets is reversed.

enumValues.name: MAGIC
enumValues.description: Sets are sorted by relevancy dependent on the state and progress of the event.

enumValues.name: RECENT
enumValues.description: Sets are sorted in the order that they were started.

enumValues.name: STANDARD
enumValues.description: Deprecated. This is equivalent to CALL_ORDER

enumValues.name: ROUND
enumValues.description: Sets sorted by round and identifier

inputFields.name: entrantIds
inputFields.description: Only return Sets for these Entrants

inputFields.name: entrantSize
inputFields.description: Only return Sets for this Entrant size. For example, to fetch 1v1 Sets only, filter by an entrantSize of 1

inputFields.name: hasVod
inputFields.description: Only return Sets that have an attached VOD

inputFields.name: hideEmpty
inputFields.description: Do not return empty Sets. For example, set this to true to filter out sets that are waiting for progressions.

inputFields.name: showByes
inputFields.description: Return sets that contain a bye

inputFields.name: isEventOnline
inputFields.description: Only return Sets that are in an Online event. If omitted, Sets for both online and offline Events are returned

inputFields.name: location
inputFields.description: Only return Sets in certain geographical areas.

inputFields.name: participantIds
inputFields.description: Only return Sets for these Participants

inputFields.name: phaseGroupIds
inputFields.description: Only return Sets in these PhaseGroups

inputFields.name: phaseIds
inputFields.description: Only return Sets in these Phases

inputFields.name: eventIds
inputFields.description: Only return Sets in these Events

inputFields.name: tournamentIds
inputFields.description: Only return Sets in these Tournaments

inputFields.name: playerIds
inputFields.description: Only return Sets for these Players

inputFields.name: roundNumber
inputFields.description: Only return Sets for these Rounds

inputFields.name: state
inputFields.description: Only returns Sets that are in these states

inputFields.name: stationIds
inputFields.description: Only return Sets that are assigned to these Station IDs

inputFields.name: stationNumbers
inputFields.description: Only return Sets that are assigned to these Station numbers

inputFields.name: updatedAfter
inputFields.description: Only return sets created or updated since this timestamp

types.name: SetFilterLocation
types.description: Filter Sets by geographical constraints.

inputFields.name: state
inputFields.description: Only return Sets in this state. Only applicable to US states

inputFields.name: country
inputFields.description: Only return Sets in this country. Expects a valid two-letter country code

types.name: SetFilterLocationDistanceFrom
types.description: Only return Sets that are a certain distance away from a specified point

inputFields.name: point
inputFields.description: Point at which to perform distance calculation

inputFields.name: radius
inputFields.description: Distance from the point to include results in

types.name: Float
types.description:
The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional
values as specified by
[IEEE 754](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: Set
types.description: A set

fields.name: completedAt
fields.description: The time this set was marked as completed

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The time this set was created

fields.name: event
fields.description: Event that this set belongs to.

fields.name: fullRoundText
fields.description: Full round text of this set.

fields.name: hasPlaceholder
fields.description: Whether this set contains a placeholder entrant

fields.name: identifier
fields.description: The letters that describe a unique identifier within the pool. Eg. F, AT

fields.name: phaseGroup
fields.description: Phase group that this Set belongs to.

fields.name: round
fields.description: The round number of the set. Negative numbers are losers bracket

fields.name: setGamesType
fields.description:
Indicates whether the set is in best of or total games mode. This instructs
which field is used to figure out how many games are in this set.

fields.name: slots
fields.description: A possible spot in a set. Use this to get all entrants in a set. Use this for all bracket types (FFA, elimination, etc)

fields.name: startAt
fields.description: The start time of the Set. If there is no startAt time on the Set, will pull it from phaseGroup rounds configuration.

fields.name: station
fields.description: Tournament event station for a set

fields.name: stream
fields.description: Tournament event stream for a set

fields.name: totalGames
fields.description: If setGamesType is in total games mode, this defined the number of games in the set.

fields.name: vodUrl
fields.description: Url of a VOD for this set

types.name: Game
types.description: A game represents a single game within a set.

fields.name: selections
fields.description: Selections for this game such as character, etc.

fields.name: stage
fields.description: The stage that this game was played on (if applicable)

types.name: Image
types.description: An image

types.name: GameSelection
types.description: A selection for this game. i.e. character/stage selection, etc

fields.name: entrant
fields.description: The entrant who this selection is for

fields.name: participant
fields.description:
The participant who this selection is for. This is only populated if there are
selections for multiple participants of a single entrant

types.name: Participant
types.description: A participant of a tournament; either a spectator or competitor

fields.name: checkedIn
fields.description: If this participant was checked-in by admin

fields.name: checkedInAt
fields.description: The time this participant was checked-in by admin

fields.name: connectedAccounts
fields.description: Info for connected accounts to external services.

fields.name: contactInfo
fields.description:
Contact Info selected during registration. Falls back to User.location and/or
User.name if necessary. These fields are for admin use only and do not respect
user privacy settings. DO NOT display this information publicly.

fields.name: email
fields.description: Email of the user, only available to admins within 18 months of tournament

fields.name: events
fields.description: The events this participant registered for.

fields.name: gamerTag
fields.description: The tag that was used in registration e.g. Mang0

fields.name: prefix
fields.description: The prefix that was used in registration e.g. C9

fields.name: requiredConnections
fields.description: Admin only field for required social connections

fields.name: user
fields.description: The user this participant is associated to.

fields.name: verified
fields.description: If this participant is verified as actually being in the tournament

types.name: ContactInfo
types.description: Name, address, etc

fields.name: city
fields.description: Participant City Name

fields.name: country
fields.description: Participant Country Name

fields.name: countryId
fields.description: Participant Country (region) id

fields.name: nameFirst
fields.description: First Name

fields.name: nameLast
fields.description: Last Name

fields.name: state
fields.description: Participant State Name

fields.name: stateId
fields.description: Participant State (region) id

fields.name: zipcode
fields.description: Zip or Postal Code

types.name: Player
types.description: A player

fields.name: rankings
fields.description: Most recent active & published rankings

fields.name: recentSets
fields.description: Recent sets for this player.

args.name: opponentId
args.description: Use this to get H2H history between two players

fields.deprecationReason: Use the sets field instead.

fields.name: sets
fields.description: Set history for this player.

args.name: filters
args.description: Supported filter options to filter down set results.

types.name: PlayerRank
types.description: A player's ranks

fields.name: rank
fields.description: The player's placement on the ranking

types.name: GameSelectionType
types.description: The type of selection i.e. is it for a character or something else

enumValues.name: CHARACTER
enumValues.description: Character selection

types.name: Stage
types.description: Video Stage

fields.name: name
fields.description: Stage name

types.name: PhaseGroup
types.description: A group within a phase

fields.name: bracketType
fields.description: The bracket type of this group's phase.

fields.name: displayIdentifier
fields.description: Unique identifier for this group within the context of its phase

fields.name: firstRoundTime
fields.description: For the given phase group, this is the start time of the first round that occurs in the group.

fields.name: paginatedSeeds
fields.deprecationReason: Please use 'seeds', which is now paginated

fields.name: paginatedSets
fields.description: Paginated sets on this phaseGroup

args.name: sortType
args.description: How to sort these sets

args.name: filters
args.description: Supported filter options to filter down set results.

fields.deprecationReason: Please use 'sets', which is now paginated

fields.name: phase
fields.description: The phase associated with this phase group

fields.name: progressionsOut
fields.description: The progressions out of this phase group

fields.name: seeds
fields.description: Paginated seeds for this phase group

fields.name: sets
fields.description: Paginated sets on this phaseGroup

args.name: sortType
args.description: How to sort these sets

args.name: filters
args.description: Supported filter options to filter down set results.

fields.name: standings
fields.description: Paginated list of standings

fields.name: startAt
fields.description: Unix time the group is scheduled to start. This info could also be on the wave instead.

types.name: BracketType
types.description: The type of Bracket format that a Phase is configured with.

inputFields.name: perPage
inputFields.description: How many nodes to return for the page. Maximum value of 500

types.name: Seed
types.description: A seed for an entrant

fields.name: checkedInParticipants
fields.description: Map of Participant ID to checked in boolean

fields.name: players
fields.description: The player(s) associated with this seed's entrant

fields.name: progressionSource
fields.description: Source progression information

fields.name: setRecordWithoutByes
fields.description: Entrant's win/loss record for this standing. Scores do not include byes.

args.name: containerType
args.description: The container of the standing groups to get standings for. If null, will return all standings.

types.name: Phase
types.description: A phase in an event

fields.name: bracketType
fields.description: The bracket type of this phase.

fields.name: event
fields.description: The Event that this phase belongs to

fields.name: groupCount
fields.description: Number of phase groups in this phase

fields.name: isExhibition
fields.description: Is the phase an exhibition or not.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of phase e.g. Round 1 Pools

fields.name: numSeeds
fields.description: The number of seeds this phase contains.

fields.name: paginatedSeeds
fields.deprecationReason: Please use 'seeds' instead

fields.name: phaseGroups
fields.description: Phase groups under this phase, paginated

fields.name: phaseOrder
fields.description: The relative order of this phase within an event

fields.name: seeds
fields.description: Paginated seeds for this phase

fields.name: sets
fields.description: Paginated sets for this Phase

args.name: sortType
args.description: How to sort these sets

args.name: filters
args.description: Supported filter options to filter down set results.

fields.name: state
fields.description: State of the phase

types.name: ActivityState
types.description: Represents the state of an activity

enumValues.name: CREATED
enumValues.description: Activity is created

enumValues.name: ACTIVE
enumValues.description: Activity is active or in progress

enumValues.name: COMPLETED
enumValues.description: Activity is done

enumValues.name: READY
enumValues.description: Activity is ready to be started

enumValues.name: INVALID
enumValues.description: Activity is invalid

enumValues.name: CALLED
enumValues.description: Activity, like a set, has been called to start

enumValues.name: QUEUED
enumValues.description: Activity is queued to run

types.name: Wave
types.description: A wave in a tournament

fields.name: identifier
fields.description: The Wave Identifier

fields.name: startAt
fields.description: Unix time the wave is scheduled to start.

types.name: Progression
types.description: A connection between a placement in an origin phase group to a destination seed.

types.name: Standing
types.description: A standing indicates the placement of something within a container.

fields.name: container
fields.description:
The containing entity that contextualizes this standing. Event standings, for
example, represent an entrant's standing in the entire event vs. Set standings
which is an entrant's standing in only a single set within an event.

fields.name: entrant
fields.description: If the entity this standing is assigned to can be resolved into an entrant, this will provide the entrant.

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: Metadata that goes along with this standing. Can take on different forms based on standing group type and settings.

fields.name: player
fields.description: The player(s) tied to this standing's entity

fields.name: standing
fields.deprecationReason: The "placement" field is identical and will eventually replace "standing"

types.name: StandingContainer
types.description: The containing entity that this standing is for

types.name: Tournament
types.description: A tournament

fields.name: admins
fields.description: Admin-only view of admins for this tournament

args.name: roles
args.description: Which roles to show

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: When the tournament was created (unix timestamp)

fields.name: endAt
fields.description: When the tournament ends

fields.name: eventRegistrationClosesAt
fields.description: When does event registration close

fields.name: hasOfflineEvents
fields.description: True if tournament has at least one offline event

fields.name: isOnline
fields.description: True if tournament has at least one online event

fields.name: isRegistrationOpen
fields.description: Is tournament registration open

fields.name: name
fields.description: The tournament name

fields.name: numAttendees
fields.description: Number of attendees including spectators, if public

fields.name: owner
fields.description: The user who created the tournament

fields.name: participants
fields.description: Paginated, queryable list of participants

fields.name: publishing
fields.description: Publishing settings for this tournament

fields.name: registrationClosesAt
fields.description: When does registration for the tournament end

fields.name: shortSlug
fields.description: The short slug used to form the url

fields.name: slug
fields.description: The slug used to form the url

fields.name: startAt
fields.description: When the tournament Starts

fields.name: state
fields.description: State of the tournament, can be ActivityState::CREATED, ActivityState::ACTIVE, or ActivityState::COMPLETED

fields.name: teamCreationClosesAt
fields.description: When is the team creation deadline

fields.name: teams
fields.description: Paginated, queryable list of teams

fields.name: timezone
fields.description: The timezone of the tournament

fields.name: tournamentType
fields.description: The type of tournament from TournamentType

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: When the tournament was last modified (unix timestamp)

fields.name: url
fields.description: Build Tournament URL

args.name: tab
args.description: Tournament tab to add to URL

args.name: relative
args.description: Generate a relative URL. Defaults to true. Setting to false will generate an absolute URL

fields.name: waves
fields.description: List of all waves in this tournament

inputFields.name: perPage
inputFields.description: How many nodes to return for the page. Maximum value of 500

types.name: Stations
types.description: Stations, such as a stream setup, at an event

types.name: StreamQueue
types.description: A Stream queue object

fields.name: sets
fields.description: The sets on the stream

fields.name: stream
fields.description: The stream on the queue

types.name: Streams
types.description: Tournament Stream

types.name: StreamSource
types.description: Represents the source of a stream

enumValues.name: TWITCH
enumValues.description: Stream is on twitch.tv channel

enumValues.name: HITBOX
enumValues.description: Stream is on smashcast.tv channel

enumValues.name: STREAMME
enumValues.description: Stream is on a stream.me channel

enumValues.name: MIXER
enumValues.description: Stream is on a mixer.com channel

inputFields.name: perPage
inputFields.description: How many nodes to return for the page. Maximum value of 500

types.name: TeamMemberStatus
types.description: Membership status of a team member

types.name: Team
types.description: A team, either at the global level or within the context of an event

fields.name: discriminator
fields.description: Uniquely identifying token for team. Same as the hashed part of the slug

fields.name: entrant
fields.deprecationReason: Use the entrant field off the EventTeam type

fields.name: event
fields.deprecationReason: Use the event field off the EventTeam type

types.name: TeamMember
types.description: A member of a team

fields.name: memberType
fields.description: The type of the team member

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of the team member

types.name: TeamMemberType
types.description: Membership type of a team member

types.name: StandingStats
types.description: Any stats related to this standing. This type is experimental and very likely to change in the future.

types.name: Score
types.description:
The score that led to this standing being awarded. The meaning of this field can
vary by standing type and is not used for some standing types.

fields.name: label
fields.description: The name of this score. e.g. "Kills" or "Stocks"

fields.name: value
fields.description: The raw score value

fields.name: displayValue
fields.description: Like value, but formatted for race format events. Formatted according to the race config for the front end to use.

types.name: Round
types.description: A round within a phase group

fields.name: bestOf
fields.description:
If applicable, bestOf is the number of games
									one must win a majority out of to win a set in this round

fields.name: number
fields.description: Indicates this round's order in the phase group

fields.name: startAt
fields.description: The time that this round is scheduled to start at

types.name: SetSlot
types.description: A slot in a set where a seed currently or will eventually exist in order to participate in the set.

fields.name: prereqId
fields.description: Pairs with prereqType, is the ID of the prereq.

fields.name: prereqPlacement
fields.description: Given a set prereq type, defines the placement required in the origin set to end up in this slot.

fields.name: prereqType
fields.description: Describes where the entity in this slot comes from.

fields.name: slotIndex
fields.description: The index of the slot. Unique per set.

fields.name: standing
fields.description: The standing within this set for the seed currently assigned to this slot.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

fields.name: onOperation
fields.deprecationReason: Use `locations`.

fields.name: onFragment
fields.deprecationReason: Use `locations`.

fields.name: onField
fields.deprecationReason: Use `locations`.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: ActionSet
types.description: A set of actions available for an entity to take

types.description: Bracket-specific configuration

types.name: Comparator
types.description: Comparison operator

fields.name: entrant

fields.name: event
fields.deprecationReason: Use the event field off the EventTeam type

fields.description: Uniquely identifying token for team. Same as the hashed part of the slug

types.name: MatchConfigVerificationMethod

types.name: RaceBracketConfig

types.name: RaceLimitMode
types.description: Enforces limits on the amount of allowable Race submissions

types.name: RaceType
types.description: Race type

types.name: RaceMatchConfig
types.description: Race specific match configuration

fields.name: playerReportingEnabled
fields.description: Can players report results?

fields.name: verificationMethods
fields.description: Accepted methods of verification that players can use

fields.name: verificationRequired
fields.description: Are players required to submit verification of their reported results?

types.name: TeamActionSet
types.description: A set of actions available for a team to take

directives.name: publicCache
directives.description:
Specify a query to be read from gql-public. Will use the configured cacheAge on
the query resolve configuration, or the override value passed through the
directive as publicCache(cacheAge: INT) argument.

args.name: cacheAge
args.description: Optional override for the query-level cacheAge value.

directives.name: userData
directives.description: Specify a field to only be included in the response if the user is logged in.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted in [Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/).
